entry.title: HowTo configure the Linux kernel for Lenovo ThinkPad X240
entry.summary:
This article describes step by step how to configure the Linux Kernel for my Lenovo ThinkPad X240. This kernel must support Intel Haswell processor, all devices and UEFI bootloader without Grub.

To get more information about the configuration of my laptop, you can read this article : Lenovo ThinkPad X240

Kernel installation

Download kernel Gentoo sources (3.18.12) :

# emerge sys-kernel/gentoo-sources sys-firmware/iwl7260-ucode

Select kernel sources

# eselect kernel list
# eselect kernel set X
# cd /usr/src/linux

Print configuration menu

# make menuconfig

Kernel minimal configuration

| General setup  --->
|      |
|      |     Timers subsystem  --->
|      |      | [*] High Resolution Timer Support
|      |
| Processor type and features  --->
|      |
|      | [*] Symmetric multi-processing support
|      | [*] Support x2apic
|      | [ ] Support for extended (non-PC) x86 platforms
|      | [*] Intel Low Power Subsystem Support
|      |     Processor family (Generic-x86-64)  --->
|      | [ ] Old AMD GART IOMMU support
|      | [ ] IBM Calgary IOMMU support
|      | [ ] Enable Maximum number of SMP Processors and NUMA Nodes
|      | [*] SMT (Hyperthreading) scheduler support
|      | [*] Multi-core scheduler support
|      | < > CPU microcode loading support
|      | <*> /dev/cpu/*/msr - Model-specific register support
|      | <*> /dev/cpu/*/cpuid - CPU information support
|      | [ ] Numa Memory Allocation and Scheduler Support
|      | [*] EFI runtime service support
|      | [*]   EFI stub support
|      | [*] Built-in kernel command line
|      | (root=/dev/sda6) Built-in kernel command string
|
| Power management and ACPI options  --->
|      |
|      | [*] Suspend to RAM and standby
|      | [*] Hibernation (aka 'suspend to disk')
|      | /dev/sda5) Default resume partition
|      |
|      | [*] ACPI (Advanced Configuration and Power Interface) Support  --->
|      |      | <*>   Processor
|      |
|      |     CPU Frequency scaling  --->
|      |      | [*] CPU Frequency scaling
|      |      | <*>   CPU frequency translation statistics
|      |      | [*]     CPU frequency translation statistics details
|      |      |       Default CPUFreq governor (conservative)  --->
|      |      | -*-   'performance' governor
|      |      | <*>   'powersave' governor
|      |      | <*>   'userspace' governor for userspace frequency scaling
|      |      | <*>   'ondemand' cpufreq policy governor
|      |      | -*-   'conservative' cpufreq governor
|      |      |       x86 CPU frequency scaling drivers  --->
|      |      |        | [*] Intel P state control
|      |      |        | < > ACPI Processor P-States driver
|      |
|      |     CPU Idle  --->
|      |      | [*] CPU idle PM support
|      |      | [ ]   Ladder governor (for periodic timer tick)
|      |      | -*-   Menu governor (for tickless system)
|      |
|      | [*] Cpuidle Driver for Intel Processors
|
| [*] Networking support  --->
|      | --- Networking support
|      |       Networking options  --->
|      |        | [*] TCP/IP networking
|      |        | < >   The IPv6 protocol  ----
|      |        | [ ]   NetLabel subsystem support
|      |
|      | [ ]   Amateur Radio support  ----
|      |
|      | -*-   Wireless  --->
|      |        | --- Wireless
|      |        | <*>   cfg80211 - wireless configuration API
|      |        | [*]     enable powersave by default
|      |        | <*>   Generic IEEE 802.11 Networking Stack (mac80211)
|      |        | [*]   Enable LED triggers
|
| Device Drivers  --->
|      |
|      |     Generic Driver Options  --->
|      |      | [*]   Include in-kernel firmware blobs in kernel binary
|      |      | (iwlwifi-7260-8.ucode) External firmware blobs to build into the kernel binary
|      |      | (/lib/firmware) Firmware blobs root directory
|      |      | [*] Fallback user-helper invocation for firmware loading
|      |
|      | <*> Serial ATA and Parallel ATA drivers (libata)  --->
|      |      | [ ]   Verbose ATA error reporting
|      |      | [ ]   SATA Port Multiplier support
|      |      | <*>   AHCI SATA support
|      |      | [ ]   ATA SFF support (for legacy IDE and PATA)
|      |
|      | [ ] Multiple devices driver support (RAID and LVM)  ----
|      | [ ] Macintosh device drivers  ----
|      |
|      | [*] Network device support  --->
|      |      | --- Network device support
|      |      | [*]   Ethernet driver support  --->
|      |      |        | --- Ethernet driver support
|      |      |        | [*]   Intel devices
|      |      |        | < >     Intel(R) PRO/100+ support
|      |      |        | <*>     Intel(R) PRO/1000 PCI-Express Gigabit Ethernet support
|      |      |        | [ ]     Intel (82586/82593/82596) devices
|      |      |
|      |      | < >   FDDI driver support
|      |      | < >   USB Network Adapters  ----
|      |      |
|      |      | [*]   Wireless LAN  --->
|      |      |        | --- Wireless LAN
|      |      |        | <*>   Intel Wireless WiFi Next Gen AGN - Wireless-N/Advanced-N/Ultimate-N (iwlwifi)
|      |      |        | < >     Intel Wireless WiFi DVM Firmware support
|      |      |        | <*>     Intel Wireless WiFi MVM Firmware support

|      |     I2C support  --->

|      |      |        | <*> Intel 82801 (ICH/PCH)

|      |      | -*-   Step_wise thermal governor
|      |      | <*>   Intel PowerClamp idle injection driver

|      |     Graphics support  --->

|      |      |      | <*> Intel 8xx/9xx/G3x/G4x/HD Graphics
|      |      |      | [*]   Enable modesetting on intel by default
|      |      |      | [*]   Enable legacy fbdev support for the modesetting intel driver
|      |
|      |     <*> Sound card support  --->
|      |      | <*>   Advanced Linux Sound Architecture  --->
|      |      |      | [*]   PCI sound devices  --->
|      |      |      |       HD-Audio  --->
|      |      |      |        | <*> HD Audio PCI
|      |      |      |        | [*] Support jack plugging notification via input layer
|      |      |      |        | <*> Build Realtek HD-audio codec support
|      |      |      |        | <*> Build HDMI/DisplayPort HD-audio codec support
|      |      |      |
|      |      |      | [ ]   USB sound devices  ----
|      |      |      | [ ]   PCMCIA sound devices  ----
|      |
|      | [*] USB support  --->
|      |      | <*>   Support for Host-side USB
|      |      | < >     USB Monitor
|      |      | <*>     xHCI HCD (USB 3.0) support
|      |      | <*>     EHCI HCD (USB 2.0) support
|      |      | < >     OHCI HCD (USB 1.1) support
|      |      | < >     UHCI HCD (most Intel and VIA) support
|      |
|      | [*] X86 Platform Specific Device Drivers  --->
|      |      | <*>   ThinkPad ACPI Laptop Extras
|      |      | [ ]     Maintainer debug facilities (NEW)
|      |      | [ ]     Verbose debug mode (NEW)
|      |      | [ ]     Allow control of important LEDs (unsafe) (NEW)
|      |      | [*]     Video output control support (NEW)
|      |      | [*]     Support NVRAM polling for hot keys (NEW)
|      |      | < >   Eee PC Hotkey Driver
|      |
|      | [*] IOMMU Hardware Support  --->
|      |      | --- IOMMU Hardware Support
|      |      | [ ]   AMD IOMMU support
|      |      | [*]   Support for Intel IOMMU using DMA Remapping Devices
|      |      | [*]     Enable Intel DMA Remapping Devices by default
|      |      | [*]   Support for Interrupt Remapping
|      |
|      | [*] Pulse-Width Modulation (PWM) Support  --->
|      |      | <*>   Intel LPSS PWM support
|      |      | <*>     Intel LPSS PWM PCI driver
|      |      | <*>     Intel LPSS PWM platform driver
|      |
|      | [*] Generic powercap sysfs driver  --->
|      |      | <*>   Intel RAPL Support
|
|    File systems  --->
|      |
|      | <*> The Extended 4 (ext4) filesystem
|      | <*> XFS filesystem support
|      | <*> FUSE (Filesystem in Userspace) support
|      |
|      | [*] Miscellaneous filesystems  ----
|      |      | <*>   EFI Variable filesystem
|      |
|      | [*] Network File Systems  --->
|      |      | --- Network File Systems
|      |      | <*>   NFS client support
|      |      | < >     NFS client support for NFS version 2
|      |      | < >     NFS client support for NFS version 3
|      |      | <*>     NFS client support for NFS version 4
|      |      | [ ]   Root file system on NFS
|      |      | <*>   CIFS support (advanced network filesystem, SMBFS successor)
|      |      | [ ]     Enable CIFS debugging routines
|
| -*- Cryptographic API  --->
|      |
|      |       *** Digest ***
|      | -*-   CRC32c CRC algorithm
|      | <*>   CRC32c INTEL hardware acceleration
|      | -*-   SHA1 digest algorithm
|      | <*>   SHA1 digest algorithm (SSSE3/AVX/AVX2)
|      | <*>   SHA256 digest algorithm (SSSE3/AVX/AVX2)
|      | <*>   SHA512 digest algorithm (SSSE3/AVX/AVX2)
|      |
|      |       *** Ciphers ***
|      | -*-   AES cipher algorithms
|      | -*-   AES cipher algorithms (x86_64)
|      | <*>   AES cipher algorithms (AES-NI)
|      |
|      | [ ]   Hardware crypto devices  ----

Kernel optional configuration

Kerberos cryptography support

| -*- Cryptographic API  --->
|      | -*- Cryptographic API --->
|      | <*>   CBC support
|      | <*>   CTS support
|      | -*-   ECB support
|      | -*-   HMAC support
|      | -*-   ARC4 cipher algorithm
|      | -*-   DES and Triple DES EDE cipher algorithms
|      | <*>   Triple DES EDE cipher algorithm (x86-64)

Virtualization with KVM

|     Bus options (PCI etc.)  --->
|      | [*] PCI support
|      | <*>   PCI Stub driver
|
| [*] Virtualization  --->
|      | --- Virtualization
|      | <*>   Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM) support
|      | <*>     KVM for Intel processors support
|      | < >     KVM for AMD processors support (NEW)
|      | [ ]     Audit KVM MMU (NEW)
|      | [ ]     KVM legacy PCI device assignment support
|      | < >   Host kernel accelerator for virtio net (NEW)

Kernel compilation

# make && make modules_install

Kernel installation

Mount ESP (EFI System Partition)

# mkdir /mnt/ESP
# mount /dev/sda2 /mnt/ESP

Create directory

# mkdir /mnt/ESP/EFI/GentooLinux

Copy kernel

# cp /usr/src/linux/arch/x86_64/boot/bzImage /mnt/ESP/EFI/GentooLinux/3.18.12.efi

Unmount ESP (EFI System Partition)

# mount /mnt/ESP

Update UEFI bootloader

Install EFI boot manager

# emerge efibootmgr

Add the new kernel

# efibootmgr -c -d /dev/sda -p 2 -L "Gentoo Linux 3.18.12" -l "\EFI\GentooLinux\3.18.12.efi"

Print the menu

# efibootmgr -v

Remove the previous kernel (after testing the new kernel)

# efibootmgr -b 15 -B

References

  • Wiki Gentoo - EFI stub kernel

entry.title: Lenovo ThinkPad X240
entry.summary:
This article describes the configuration of my Lenovo ThinkPad X240 (20ALCT01WW) based on Intel Haswell processor. Future articles will refer to this one.

Devices

  • Processor: Intel i4300u (Haswell)
  • Memory : 8 Go DDR3L PC3-12800 1600 MHz
  • Graphics Controller: Intel HD Graphics 4400
  • Screen: 12.5" FHD (1920 x 1080) LED Backlit AntiGlare IPS Display
  • Audio controller : Intel HD Audio
  • Intel Ethernet Connection I218 LM
  • Intel Wireless 7260
  • Hard Disk Drive: HGST 500 Go replaced by an SDD Samsung 840 Pro 256 Go
  • WebCam: Lite-On Integrated Camera (USB)
  • SD card Reader: Realtek RTS5227 (PCI Express)
  • Smartcard Reader : Alcor Micro AU9540 (USB)
  • Fingerprint Reader : Validity Sensors (USB)
  • NFC Reader : Broadcom (SMbus)

Controller

  • PCI Express
  • USB xHCI (USB3)
  • USB EHCI (USB2)
  • SATA
  • LPC (Low Pin Count)
  • SMbus (System Management Bus)
  • HECI (Host Embedded Controller Interface)

UEFI BIOS

Version

  • Package version: 2.30 (GIUJ18US)
  • BIOS / UEFI version: 2.30 (GIET80WW)
  • ECP (Embedded Controller Programm) version: 1.13 (GIHT29WW)

configuration

Menu "Security / Virtualization"

Intel (R) Virtualization Technologie [Enabled]
Intel (R) VT-d Feature               [Enabled]

Menu " Security / Secure Boot"

Secure Boot                         [Disabled]

Menu "Startup"

UEFI / Legacy Boot                 [UEFI Only]
-CSM support                              [No]
Boot Mode                              [Quick]

Partition Table

This partition table is created in GPT (GUID Partition Table) during Microsoft Windows 8.1 installation process

# Size Type Description
1 300 Mo Basic Data Partition Windows 8.1 - Recovery
2 100 Mo EFI System Partition Windows 8.1 - EFI
3 128 Mo Microsoft reserved part Windows 8.1 - Reserved
4 49,5 Go Basic Data Partition Windows 8.1
5 8 Go Linux Swap Linux Swap
6 50 Go Linux Linux Gentoo

entry.title: HowTo support FAT64 on Gentoo
entry.summary:
FAT64 or ExFAT (Extended File Allocation Table) is a file system introduced in 2009 by Microsoft. This is the successor to FAT32 that addresses the need to store larges files. With FAT64, the theoretical maximum file size is 64 ZB instead of 4GB for FAT32.

This file systen is supported by Microsoft Windows (XP, Vista, Seven,...), MacOS, Linux and Android. For linux, FAT64 is not supported directly in the kernel but with FUSE (Filesystem in UserSpacE).

This article describes step by step how to support FAT64 on Gentoo Linux.

Installation

Kernel configuration :

|     File systems  --->
|      | <*> FUSE (Filesystem in Userspace) support
|      | <*>   Character device in Userspace support

software installation :

# emerge sys-fs/fuse-exfat sys-fs/exfat-utils

Usage

Format the partition

# mkfs.exfat /dev/sdxy

Check the partition

# fsck.exfat /dev/sdxy

Mount the partition

# mount -t exfat /dev/sdxy /mnt/usb

References

  • Microsoft - Description of the ExFAT file system driver

entry.title: HowTo make a web site with Pelican hosted on GitHub Pages
entry.summary:
Pelican is a static site generator writed in Python. This means that you edit the content on your computer with a simple text editor. Then, a generator makes all HTML pages for the web site, including indexes for articles, categories and tags. In the end, your web site can be hosted easily on a simple HTTP server like GitHub Pages or Amazon S3.

Unlike other CMS (Content Management System) like Wordpress or Drupal, Pelican has no web administration interface. In most cases, the administration interface has many vulnerabilies used to deface the website.

This article describes step by step how to make your web site with Pelican 3.5 on Gentoo Linux and how to host your web site on GitHub Pages.

Install Pelican

# emerge pelican

Create GitHub space

On GitHub, create an account named "didier-bernaudeau" then a repository named "didier-bernaudeau.github.io". Obviously, remplace "didier-bernaudeau" by your username.

DNS Configuration

Add a record in the DNS :

Type : CNAME
Name : didier.bernaudeau.net
Value : didier-bernaudeau.github.io.

Check configuration with "dig" tool :

# emerge bind-tools

$ dig didier.bernaudeau.net +nostats +nocomments +nocmd

; <<>> DiG 9.10.1-P1 <<>> didier.bernaudeau.net +nostats +nocomments +nocmd
;; global options: +cmd
;didier.bernaudeau.net.         IN      A
didier.bernaudeau.net.  10800   IN      CNAME   didier-bernaudeau.github.io.
didier-bernaudeau.github.io. 3600 IN    CNAME   github.map.fastly.net.
github.map.fastly.net.  30      IN      A       185.31.17.133

Create local directory

$ git clone https://github.com/didier-bernaudeau/didier-bernaudeau.github.io.git/ MyWebSite
$ cd MyWebSite

Create project

$ pelican-quickstart

> Where do you want to create your new web site? [.]
> What will be the title of this web site? D. Bernaudeau
> Who will be the author of this web site? D. Bernaudeau
> What will be the default language of this web site? [en]
> Do you want to specify a URL prefix? e.g., http://example.com   (Y/n) Y
> What is your URL prefix? (see above example; no trailing slash) http://didier.bernaudeau.net
> Do you want to enable article pagination? (Y/n) n
> Do you want to generate a Fabfile/Makefile to automate generation and publishing? (Y/n) Y
> Do you want an auto-reload & simpleHTTP script to assist with theme and site development? (Y/n) n
> Do you want to upload your website using FTP? (y/N) N
> Do you want to upload your website using SSH? (y/N) N
> Do you want to upload your website using Dropbox? (y/N) N
> Do you want to upload your website using S3? (y/N) N
> Do you want to upload your website using Rackspace Cloud Files? (y/N) N
> Do you want to upload your website using GitHub Pages? (y/N) y
> Is this your personal page (username.github.io)? (y/N) y

Download the theme

For my web site, I selected the theme "Bootstrap3" and the style sheet "Bootswatch".

$ cd MyWebSite
$ git clone https://github.com/DandyDev/pelican-bootstrap3.git/ theme
$ cd theme/static/css/
$ wget https://bootswatch.com/bower_components/bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css
$ wget https://bootswatch.com/bower_components/bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.css

Moreover, I have edited the theme to change the font size of "blockquote" section (bootstrap.flatly.min.css).

Download plugins

$ cd MyWebSite
$ git clone --recursive https://github.com/getpelican/pelican-plugins plugins

Create GitHub Files

$ cd MyWebSite
$ mkdir content/GitHubFiles

Write your domain name in CNAME Files :

$ nano content/GitHubFiles/CNAME

didier.bernaudeau.net

Disable indexation by web search engine :

$ nano content/GitHubFiles/robots.txt

User-agent: *
Disallow:/

Pelican Configuration

$ nano pelicanconf.py

# Hide Blogroll
#LINKS =

# Hide Social widget
#SOCIAL =

# Define the theme
THEME = 'theme/'
BOOTSTRAP_THEME = 'flatly'

# Define menu options
DISPLAY_CATEGORIES_ON_MENU = False
DISPLAY_PAGES_ON_MENU = True
MENUITEMS = (
   ('Articles', '/'),
)

# Define index options
DISPLAY_ARTICLE_INFO_ON_INDEX = True
SUMMARY_MAX_LENGTH = 50

# Add description about author
ABOUT_ME = '...'

# Define sidebar options (With cloud tag)
DISPLAY_TAGS_ON_SIDEBAR = True
DISPLAY_TAGS_INLINE = True

# Add Creative Common licence in the footer
CC_LICENSE = 'CC-BY-NC-ND'

# Add plugins (Summary)
PLUGIN_PATHS = ['plugins']
PLUGINS = ['summary']

# Add static paths will be copied without parsing their contents
STATIC_PATHS = ['presentation', 'GitHubFiles']

# Shift the installed location of a file
EXTRA_PATH_METADATA = {
   'GitHubFiles/CNAME': {'path': 'CNAME'},
   'GitHubFiles/robots.txt': {'path': 'robots.txt'},
}

Create an article in reStructuredText

$ nano content/test.rst

Article title
#############

:date: AAAA-MM-JJ HH:MM
:modified: AAAA-MM-JJ HH:MM
:tags: word1, word2
:category: MyCategory
:slug: Article-title
:authors: MyName

Introduction ...

.. PELICAN_END_SUMMARY

Content ...

Generate the web site

$ make html

Preview the web site

$ make serve
$ firefox localhost:8000

Publish the web site on GitHub

$ make github

Username for 'https://github.com': didier-bernaudeau
Password for 'https://didier-bernaudeau@github.com': *************************

References

  • Pelican
  • Pelican plugins
  • Pelican theme - Bootstrap 3
  • How to set up a Pelican blog with Github pages (by Dheepak Krishnamurthy)
